eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: VegeTato, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Run the provided action (*on every frame*, i.e: without a condition) to make the orbiting objects move.
The extension will take care of creating/deleting orbiting objects to match the quantity specified. 
Use the delete function or set the quantity to 0 to remove orbiting objects.

The customizable parameters include:
- Which center object to use
- Orbiting object (cannot be the same object used for the Center object)
- Quantity of orbiting objects
- Distance from the center object
- Speed of the orbiting objects (in degrees per second).  Use negative numbers to orbit counter-clockwise.
- Speed to rotate each orbiting object (in degrees per second).  Use negative numbers to rotate counter-clockwise.

Example uses:
- Make shield objects around the player to protect from enemies
- Weapons that can damage enemies when they collide
- Can be used on both player and NPC objects 
- A visual indicator of ammo quantity or health points
- Interesting animations that can function as a single entity (try using short orbit distances)
- Visual cue for an active character power-up, such as invincibility
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Make objects orbit around a center object
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: OrbitingObjects
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make objects orbit around a center object. You can customize the number of objects, speed, etc...

eventsFunctions.description: Make objects orbit around a center object.  Objects will be automatically created/deleted to match the quantity.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Make objects orbit around a center object
eventsFunctions.name: AnimateOrbitingObjects
eventsFunctions.sentence: Animate _PARAM3_ copies of _PARAM2_ that orbit around _PARAM1_ at a distance of _PARAM5_ with orbit speed of _PARAM4_ degrees per second. Rotate orbiting objects at _PARAM6_ degrees per second.  Start objects with an angle offset of _PARAM9_ degrees.  Create objects on layer _PARAM7_ with Z value _PARAM8_.  Reset locations of orbiting objects after quantity is reduced: _PARAM10_

events.name: Count the number of linked objects (always)

events.comment: Note:  Must use the Action form of "Take into account" so that this variable is set to 0 when there are no linked objects
Create orbiting objects and link them to the center object
Match the angle used by the rest of the orbiting objects
Calculate new angle for this frame
Save the current angle so it can be used for new orbiting objects

parameters.longDescription: Cannot be the same object used for the Center object

parameters.longDescription: Use negative numbers to orbit counter-clockwise
parameters.name: OrbitSpeed

parameters.longDescription: Use negative numbers to rotate counter-clockwise
parameters.name: ObjectRotationSpeed

parameters.description: Layer that orbiting objects will be created on (base layer if empty)

parameters.description: Reset locations of orbiting objects after quantity is reduced

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy31, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Ideal for explosions, hit/impacts, earthquake, etc.

Select one or more methods of shaking:
- Position:  Shake the X and/or Y position of the camera 
- Angle: Shake the rotation of the camera 
- Zoom: Shake the zoom level of the camera 

Control how the camera shakes:
- Amplitude: How far the camera moves during each shake
- Duration: Amount of time to shake the camera
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each change of the movement of the camera
- Keep shaking until stopped (boolean)

Tips:
- For a single-shake effect, set the "Time between shakes" to be equal to "Duration"  (great for a hit or impact)
- To make the single-shake move in the opposite direction, use negative numbers 
- To repeat a single-shake effect in a loop, add a condition "Camera is not shaking" 
- Use a long "Time between shakes" to simulate a slow moving object (like a ship rocking back and forth)
- Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters. 
- Use "Shake until stopped" to simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CameraShake
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake the camera on the specified layer using one or more methods of shaking (position, angle, zoom).

eventsFunctions.description: Shake the camera on the specified layer, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, zoom).
eventsFunctions.name: CameraShake
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake camera on _PARAM3_ layer for _PARAM5_ seconds. Use an amplitude of _PARAM1_px on X axis and _PARAM2_px on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM6_ degrees, and zoom amplitude _PARAM7_ percent.  Wait _PARAM8_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM9_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of shaking on the X axis (pixels) (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of shaking on the Y axis (pixels) (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Every "odd" shake, rotate clockwise (this includes the initial shake and can be used for a one shake effect)
Calculate camera zoom displacement, with linear decay over time
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached or if stop shaking has been requested

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct drift from previous shake

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
After adding this to an object, you have to **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Flash

parameters.name: FlashDuration

eventsFunctions.name: Stop

propertyDescriptors.label: Half period (time during which object is invisible), in seconds

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Adds an action to locate the player, and track if the permissions have been given.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Geolocation
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds tools to locate the player.

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the status of the geolocation permission
eventsFunctions.name: PermissionStatus

eventsFunctions.description: Detects when the player's device is moved and get its new location. If the permission status is pending, it will ask for user permission. Every time the location is updated, stores it in the global variable of your choice.
eventsFunctions.name: WatchPlayer
eventsFunctions.sentence: Watch player movements and store the results in global variable _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Locates the player. If the permission status is pending, it will ask for user permission. Once the location is fetched, stores it in a scene variable of your choice.
eventsFunctions.name: LocatePlayer
eventsFunctions.sentence: Locate the player and store the results in scene variable _PARAM1_
